title: After GOP Office Firebombed, NBC's Lester Holt Showcases Republican Violence
content:
As Barack Obama ’ s former Chief of Staff Rahm Emanuel famously said , “ you never want a good crisis to go to waste. ” Now it appears that a ‘ good crisis ’ can even be used against the victims of that crisis . Okay maybe not a crisis , but a firebombing , for sure .
Such was the case on Monday ’ s NBC Nightly News when Lester Holt indirectly blamed the firebombing of a North Carolina Republican Party office over the weekend on “ tensions [ that ] have been rising all year in a campaign that ’ s seen undertones of violence . ”
NBC reporter Peter Alexander was ‘ all-in , ’ providing several examples of Republican ‘ violence ’ — again , during a supposed segment on the firebombing of a GOP office .
“ The president of the Arizona Republic newspaper says after it endorsed Hillary Clinton last month , the staff ’ s been getting death threats , even the students who sell subscriptions. ” “ A Trump supporter [ Milwaukee Sheriff David Clarke ] lit up social media over the weekend , tweeting that instead of complaining about government and big media , it ’ s ‘ Pitchforks and torches time . ’ ”
“ On Sunday , an online appeal asked for donations to help Republicans reopen that firebombed office . The money was raised by a Massachusetts Democrat . ”
In related news , CNN media reporter Brian Stelter cut out the ‘ middlemen ’ and went straight after Trump .
“ We have no idea who has done this . We don ’ t know if it ’ s a Republican , a Democrat , a movement . [ … ] But that kind of action is unacceptable . And we need to have the temperature come down on all sides right now . Unfortunately , Donald Trump is in the lead in terms of raising the temperature at this moment in time . ”
Authorities said on Monday that no suspects have yet been identified . Party officials reopened a makeshift operation on folding tables outside the burned-out office .
content_original:
As Barack Obama’s former Chief of Staff Rahm Emanuel famously said, “you never want a good crisis to go to waste.” Now it appears that a ‘good crisis’ can even be used against the victims of that crisis. Okay maybe not a crisis, but a firebombing, for sure.

Such was the case on Monday’s NBC Nightly News when Lester Holt indirectly blamed the firebombing of a North Carolina Republican Party office over the weekend on “tensions [that] have been rising all year in a campaign that’s seen undertones of violence.”

Translation: It was Donald Trump’s fault.

NBC reporter Peter Alexander was ‘all-in,’ providing several examples of Republican ‘violence’ — again, during a supposed segment on the firebombing of a GOP office.

“The president of the Arizona Republic newspaper says after it endorsed Hillary Clinton last month, the staff’s been getting death threats, even the students who sell subscriptions.” “A Trump supporter [Milwaukee Sheriff David Clarke] lit up social media over the weekend, tweeting that instead of complaining about government and big media, it’s ‘Pitchforks and torches time.’”

Alexander gleefully closed out the segment with this:

“On Sunday, an online appeal asked for donations to help Republicans reopen that firebombed office. The money was raised by a Massachusetts Democrat.”

Sweet, huh?

In related news, CNN media reporter Brian Stelter cut out the ‘middlemen’ and went straight after Trump.

“We have no idea who has done this. We don’t know if it’s a Republican, a Democrat, a movement. […] But that kind of action is unacceptable. And we need to have the temperature come down on all sides right now. Unfortunately, Donald Trump is in the lead in terms of raising the temperature at this moment in time.”

Authorities said on Monday that no suspects have yet been identified. Party officials reopened a makeshift operation on folding tables outside the burned-out office.
